humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " speak " and " pi ", the original meaning is metaphor and analogy. "Shu Wen": "Yue Ye. From the words, to open the sound." "Poetry·Daya·Ya·Yu": "It is not far to take the analogy, but the sky is not too far." Zheng Xuanjian: "Today I cannot take the analogy for the king. Wei Jin Er."

" For example " can mean admonition and persuasion. "The Book of the Later Han-The Fifth Biography": "Although there are good soldiers today, it is difficult to go to the enemy, please go and surrender."

" For example " also means knowing and understanding. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-Du Shi Zhuan": "Only the Huns did not exemplify the sacred virtues, and the majestic insults the two, and the mausoleum abuses China." Li Xian's note: "For example, it is still Xiaoxiao."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " yan " and " pi ", the original meaning is metaphor and analogy.
humanum_full_description:
從「言」，「辟」聲，本義為比喻、比方。《說文》：「諭也。从言，辟聲。」《詩‧大雅‧抑》：「取譬不遠，昊天不忒。」鄭玄箋：「今我為王取譬喻不及遠也，維近耳。」

　　「譬」可表示曉諭、勸導。《後漢書‧第五種傳》：「今雖有精兵，難以赴敵，羽請往譬降之。」

　　「譬」也表示通曉、明白。《後漢書‧杜詩傳》：「唯匈奴未譬聖德，威侮二垂，陵虐中國。」李賢注：「譬猶曉也。」
